title: Ex-Team Sky doctor Richard Freeman's tribunal re-listed for later this month
text:
The medical tribunal involving the ex-Team Sky doctor who allegedly ordered a banned substance for an athlete has been re-listed to begin later this month.

Dr Richard Freeman could finally be grilled on several serious allegations made by the General Medical Council (GMC), including that he ordered testosterone gel to the British Cycling headquarters in 2011.

The original hearing in February never got underway due to weeks of legal argument, much to the frustration of both British Cycling and the GMC.

Dr Richard Freeman's medical tribunal has been re-listed to begin later this month

Dr Freeman, who was at the centre of the Jiffy Bag controversy, has become an elusive figure, having not appeared at a parliamentary hearing in 2017 on mental health grounds and then not showing up as a witness for former GB cyclist Jess Varnish at her employment tribunal last year.

He resigned as British team doctor in 2017, having failed to give evidence to an internal probe into the delivery of testosterone to the National Cycling Centre.

A new Medical Practitioners Tribunal Service hearing has been scheduled to take place between 28 October and 20 December in Manchester.
